STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 20, 2021
Antoinette Prabucki
Clare County DHHS
725 Richard Drive
Harrison, MI 48625
RE: License #: CP180201067
Clare County DHHS
725 Richard Drive
Harrison, MI 48625
Dear Ms. Prabucki:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/16/2021. You have submitted an acceptable written corrective action plan covering
the violations cited in the report. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes
and rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. Your certificate of approval
license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who have
children placed in the home shall be notified there is a
corrective action plan and what is required of the foster
parent in that plan.
Two of the two special evaluations that were reviewed found noncompliance that
required a corrective action plan. The documentation indicated the foster care
worker with children in the home was given a copy of the completed special
investigation report, but there was no documentation the worker was notified what
was required of the foster parent in the corrective action plan.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(4) If an emergency change in placement is necessary, then
all of the documentation required in subrules (2) and (3) of
this rule shall be in the child's record within 14 calendar
days after the change in placement.
One of the three current foster child records reviewed indicated the foster child had a
change in placement and the documentation required for the change in placement
was not completed within the time frame required by this rule. In this file the youth
had a change in placement 06/27/2021 and the documentation required for this
change was completed 07/13/2021.
2

R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(1) An agency shall develop service plans with the child, the
child's parents or legal guardian, the referring agency, and the
other parties involved in providing needed services, or medical
care, unless the agency documents why any of the entities have
not been involved.
Two of the three current foster child records reviewed did not have adequate
documentation that the entities identified in this rule were involved in the
development of the service plans. In the first file there was no Parent Agency
Treatment Plan to document this involvement for the time period 05/25/2021 –
08/20/2021. In the second foster care child record there was no Parent Agency
Treatment Plan to document this involvement for the time period 05/11/2021-
08/03/2021.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational
statewide automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which
will be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
One of the three current foster child records reviewed had an updated service plan
that was identified as completed 08/03/2021 but only a “draft” copy of this report
could be located in the MISACWIS information system. There were also a number
of other completed reports that were located that did not include worker and
supervisory signatures.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED (Previously cited Interim 01/06/2021)
CAP Approved 01/27/2021.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
• All signed documents should include dates of signature
• Review medical passports for updated appointments and signatures as
needed.
3

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None needed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period for the interim evaluation completed
01/06/2021. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that evaluation were R
400.12413 (1)(d)(iii), R 400.12418 (2)(b) and ISEP 4.22. The only area identified as
a repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal review is ISEP 4.22.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment provided an analysis and action steps to
address areas of noncompliance. Some of the areas identified impacting services
included staffing issues, training, and COVID related circumstances.
Interviews
Four foster care services related staff participated in entrance and exit conferences
with no significant concerns noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
09/17/2021
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
4

Approved By:
September 20, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
